etymologies: late Middle English: probably from an Anglo-Norman French alteration of Old French vestiarie, from Latin vestiarium

definitions: a room or building attached to a church, used as an office and for changing into vestments.
shortDefinitions: room or building attached to church, used as office and for changing into ceremonial vestments

definitions: a meeting of parishioners, originally in a vestry, for the conduct of parochial business.
shortDefinitions: meeting of parishioners for conduct of parochial business

definitions: a body of parishioners meeting in a vestry.
shortDefinitions: body of parishioners meeting in such way
